page.title: 06DENWICK HAMLET CHURCH.
page.content: Denwick Church was built in the late 19th century because the villagers wanted a church of their own away from Alnwick.It is probably{one of the {newest buildings}in the village and its opening was marked by{a photograph {of notable villagers}which still hangs in the church.It is a very simple stone built church with a sturdy wooden door.Although it is not dedicated to a particular saint,one of the small,gothic stained glass windows commemorates{St.Anne.}The furniture is very simple;rush seated chairs,a small altar and no pulpit.{Mrs.Dixon } remembered a time when the villagers had to be in Church{before}the bell started ringing in order to get a seat, but now the Vicar is happy that there are usually{8-10}in his {fortnightly}congregation.
